item.title: Elevator, 22nd June
item.description:

item.title: Cycle hangar destroyed, metal edges everywhere, 22nd June
item.description:
The cycle hangar has been destroyed by some significant force, it is at an angle so there are dangerous metal edges at head height across the pavement. Itâ€™s also totally open with sawn off metal inside and sharp edges everywhere at just the height a child would go and play with. It has been like this for a fortnight now and must be removed urgently. It must also then be replaced as soon as possible as we cannot lose bike storage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canada Estate, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Battery Road, London

item.title: Priory gardens - middle park, flooded., 22nd June
item.description:
The middle of the park, next to large pond is almost entirety flooded, has been for weeks. Only one of the benches is now accessible. A stream has been formed in middle, flowing to adjacent small pond. What is council doing about this? How much longer will it take to be resolved? Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
